Picked this restaurant because of a blog I read from an avid traveler who'd had an excellent experience here. So glad we took his recommendation! First,  let me say that this is a nice restaurant but small.  Reservations should be made, once a number of seats are filled they do not accept walk ins.They have a prix fix menu with tons of options that I highly recommend, the price includes wine or sangria (an entire bottle), a great value!  However,  if you would rather,  there's a separate,  a la cart menu as well. Upon seating,  everyone is greated with a complimentary glass of Cava. For our first course I chose the charcuterie platter of meats (a huge sampling) that included salamies, ham, etc. My boyfriend chose potatoes with foie gras and fried egg. This may sound random,  but it is amazingly delicious! For my entrée I ordered seabass and he ordered the steak.  Both were great. I was served a whole fish, I just kinda stared for a second and asked the server how I begin to filet the fish. The owner/chef was behind her heard my request.  He swooped in, took the plate and a little later returned with the fish nicely fileted and ready to eat!For dessert we had the cream brule,  well, Spain's version.  It was just okay.  Top sugar was a bit burned. But,  our server gave us a lemoncello instead, much better in my opinion!  This restaurant serves delicious food with great service in a nice atmosphere.  I'd definitely recommend.
